speaker: LANCE
text: When a man’s servant shall play the cur with

speaker: LANCE
text: him, look you, it goes hard—one that I brought up

speaker: LANCE
text: of a puppy, one that I saved from drowning when

speaker: LANCE
text: three or four of his blind brothers and sisters went

speaker: LANCE
text: to it. I have taught him even as one would say

speaker: LANCE
text: precisely “Thus I would teach a dog.” I was sent to

speaker: LANCE
text: deliver him as a present to Mistress Sylvia from my

speaker: LANCE
text: master; and I came no sooner into the dining

speaker: LANCE
text: chamber but he steps me to her trencher and steals

speaker: LANCE
text: her capon’s leg. O, ’tis a foul thing when a cur

speaker: LANCE
text: cannot keep himself in all companies! I would have,

speaker: LANCE
text: as one should say, one that takes upon him to be a

speaker: LANCE
text: dog indeed; to be, as it were, a dog at all things. If I

speaker: LANCE
text: had not had more wit than he, to take a fault upon

speaker: LANCE
text: me that he did, I think verily he had been hanged

speaker: LANCE
text: for ’t. Sure as I live, he had suffered for ’t. You shall

speaker: LANCE
text: judge. He thrusts me himself into the company of

speaker: LANCE
text: three or four gentlemanlike dogs under the Duke’s

speaker: LANCE
text: table; he had not been there—bless the mark!—a

speaker: LANCE
text: pissing while but all the chamber smelt him. “Out

speaker: LANCE
text: with the dog!” says one. “What cur is that?” says

speaker: LANCE
text: another. “Whip him out!” says the third. “Hang him

speaker: LANCE
text: up!” says the Duke. I, having been acquainted with

speaker: LANCE
text: the smell before, knew it was Crab, and goes me to

speaker: LANCE
text: the fellow that whips the dogs. “Friend,” quoth I,

speaker: LANCE
text: “You mean to whip the dog?” “Ay, marry, do I,”

speaker: LANCE
text: quoth he. “You do him the more wrong,” quoth I.

speaker: LANCE
text: “’Twas I did the thing you wot of.” He makes me no

speaker: LANCE
text: more ado but whips me out of the chamber. How

speaker: LANCE
text: many masters would do this for his servant? Nay,

speaker: LANCE
text: I’ll be sworn I have sat in the stocks for puddings he

speaker: LANCE
text: hath stolen; otherwise he had been executed. I have

speaker: LANCE
text: stood on the pillory for geese he hath killed; otherwise

speaker: LANCE
text:
he had suffered for ’t.
